intro: Achyrophorus grandiflorus, commonly known as the large-flowered achyrophorus, is a herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, showy white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats. Achyrophorus grandiflorus is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables.
